content:
RepairTask RepairTask Class

In this Article

Edit

Represents a repair task, which includes information about what kind of repair was requested, what its progress is, and what its final result was.

This class supports the Service Fabric platform; it is not meant to be called directly from your code.

Syntax

Declaration

public class RepairTaskPublic Class RepairTask

  • Edit
    Impact
    Impact

    Gets an object that describes the impact of the repair.

    public RepairImpactDescription Impact { get; set; }Public Property Impact As RepairImpactDescription

    Property Value

    • RepairImpactDescription
      RepairImpactDescription

      A RepairImpactDescription object that describes the impact of the repair.

    Remarks

    Impact must be specified by the repair executor upon transitioning to the Preparing state. The impact object determines what actions the system will take to prepare for the impact of the repair, prior to approving execution of the repair.

  • Edit
    Scope
    Scope

    Gets an object describing the scope of the repair task.

    public RepairScopeIdentifier Scope { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Scope As RepairScopeIdentifier

    Property Value

    • RepairScopeIdentifier
      RepairScopeIdentifier

      A RepairScopeIdentifier object describing the scope of the repair task.

    Remarks

    The repair task scope determines the resource against which access checks are performed when the repair task is created, modified, deleted, or retrieved. Entities impacted by a repair must be contained within the scope of the repair task. For example, repairs which impact nodes require that the repair task be created under the Cluster scope.

  • Edit

    Gets or sets an object describing which entities the requested repair action is targeting.

    public RepairTargetDescription Target { get; set; }Public Property Target As RepairTargetDescription

    Property Value

    • RepairTargetDescription
      RepairTargetDescription

      An object describing which entities the requested repair action is targeting.

    Remarks

    Target may be null if the repair action does not require information about specific targets.

  • Edit
    TaskId
    TaskId

    Gets the identifier of the repair task.

    public string TaskId { get; }Public ReadOnly Property TaskId As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

      The identifier of the repair task.

  • Edit
    Version
    Version

    Gets or sets the version of the repair task.

    public long Version { get; set; }Public Property Version As Long

    Property Value

    • Int64
      Int64

      The version of the repair task.

    Remarks

    When creating a new repair task, the version must be set to zero. When updating a repair task via the UpdateRepairExecutionStateAsync method, the version is used for optimistic concurrency checks. If the version is set to zero, the update will not check for write conflicts. If the version is set to a non-zero value, then the update will only succeed if the actual current version of the repair task matches this value.
